Title: World No.1 golfer Scottie Scheffler leaves PGA Championships in handcuffs after police confrontation
Author: Jake Santa Maria, Jake Santa Mariathe
Content: The West Australian Perth Now Click to open navigation ‌‌ News Chevron Down Icon Breaking News Western Australia National World Technology Opinion Weather Sport Chevron Down Icon AFL Cricket Soccer Basketball Tennis NRL Rugby Motor Racing MMA Golf Netball Cycling Entertainment Chevron Down Icon Confidential Movies Best Short Film Television Music Reviews Books Competitions Business Chevron Down Icon Breaking News Economy Markets Property Commercial Property Workplace Matters Lifestyle Chevron Down Icon Food Personal Finance Health Parenting Fashion Travel Home & Garden Relationships Stars Real Estate HUH? Local News Chevron Down Icon North Central South Mandurah Competitions Find My Paper Digital Editions Shop Now Read your local paperNews to your inbox AFL Cricket Soccer Basketball Tennis NRL Rugby Motor Racing MMA Golf Netball Cycling Camera IconScottie Scheffler has been arrested outside of Valhalla golf course.Credit: Andrew Redington/Getty Images World No.1 golfer Scottie Scheffler leaves PGA Championships in handcuffs after police confrontation Jake Santa MariaThe West Australian May 17, 2024 7:58PM Comments TopicsGolf World No.1 golfer Scottie Scheffler has been escorted away from the PGA Championships in handcuffs after a reported traffic flow misunderstanding. In stunning vision captured by ESPN reporter Jeff Darlington, Scheffler is seen being escorted by police in handcuffs near the entrance of the Valhalla Golf Club. Your cookie settings are preventing this third party content from displaying. If you’d like to view this content, please adjust your Cookie Settings. To find out more about how we use cookies, please see our Cookie Guide. According to Darlington, Scheffler was attempting to enter the course ahead of his second-round tee time before he was involved in an interaction with police after failing to stop. TheNightly Get in front of tomorrow's news for FREE Journalism for the curious Australian across politics, business, culture and opinion.READ NOW Speaking on ESPN Darlington said the situation moved “very quickly, very rapidly, very aggressively” and reported Scheffler told Darlington “please help me,” as he was being taken away. Scheffler was tied for 12th after the first round at Valhalla after a four-under 67 it is unknown if he will be able to resume his challenge. The world No 1 was due to tee off for his second round at 8:48 ET alongside Wyndham Clark and Brian Harman “Right now he’s going to jail, and there ain’t nothing you can do about it,” a police officer told Darlington. The incident occurred as the second round of the PGA Championship was delayed Friday due to a fatal accident near the club. A pedestrian was reportedly hit and killed but a shuttle bus outside the golf course in a separate incident to Scheffler’s arrest. It is claimed the star golfer was confused but the traffic cordon set-up. Share to Facebook Share to Twitter Email Us Copy the Link Register and have your say. Title: Controversial Portrait Of Australia's Richest Woman Sparks Debate on Creative Expression
Author: Shreyashi Chakraborty
Content: A portrait of Australian mining mogul Gina Rinehart by Indigenous artist Vincent Namatjira has caused controversy and sparked a discussion about creative expression and public figure portrayals.The image of Rinehart, which is currently hanging in the National Gallery of Australia, has drawn criticism from Olympic swimmers and their governing organization, who labeled it "offensive" and demanded that it be removed.Rinehart is also reportedly upset by her depiction and had asked the National Gallery to remove the portrait.Reacting to the scrutiny, artist Namatjira said, "We are all equal in Australia... No matter what heritage you are, or where you come from... We are all Australian."This is not the only piece under scrutiny; the campaign also targeted another of his black and white portraits of her, most likely done in pencil and ink. These pieces are a part of Namatjira's "Australia in Colour," a wider series that consists of 21 satirical portraits of well-known Australian and foreign personalities, The Guardian reported.Aside from being the richest woman in Australia, Rinehart is famous for her humanitarian work and substantial financial support of Australian sports, especially swimming. Rinehart has spoken out on some topics like climate change and laws protecting Indigenous heritage, and has engaged in public court disputes with her family.Rinehart continues to be a major financial supporter of Australian swimming even though she has stopped providing direct financing to the organization that oversees swimming in Australia.She also reportedly started the Hancock Prospecting Swimmer Support Scheme, a scheme that provides direct money to 92 competitive swimmers, after parting ways with Swimming Australia.However, in 2022, Rinehart had withdrawn a $15 million sponsorship to Netball Australia after Donnell Wallam, an Indigenous netballer, requested that her uniform should not have the logo of Hancock Prospecting.Rio Olympic freestyle gold medalist Kyle Chalmers along with chief executive of Swimming Queensland Kevin Hasemann rallied several Australian athletes to urge that the photos be taken down. In a letter to Nick Mitzevich, the director of the national gallery, Hasemann himself made it clear that the letter was sent "on behalf of members of the Australian swim team.""At the national championships, [the art] was definitely the talk of the swimming pool and everyone [was] throwing their support behind our patron that makes everything possible for us," Chalmers said. "I think she just deserves to be praised and looked upon definitely a lot better than what the portraits have made her out to be," BBC reported.However, in a statement, the gallery said, "We present works of art to the Australian public to inspire people to explore, experience and learn about art," essentially rejecting requests for the pictures to be taken down.

Title: AIFF rejects premier 1 club license of Jamshedpur FC, Odisha FC, Kerala Blasters and Hyderabad FC
Author: India News Newsdesk
Content: New Delhi, May 17 (IANS) All India Football Federation’s (AIFF) Club Licensing Committee rejected the Premier 1 license of Indian Super League (ISL) clubs Jamshedpur FC, Odisha FC, Kerala Blasters and Hyderabad FC for the upcoming 2024-25 season. The clubs were found disobeying multiple ‘A’ criteria failures, making them ineligible for AFC Club competitions and the national competitions. The clubs, however, have options to seek an exemption to participate in the National competitions by May 22. The committee was chaired by Girija Shanker Mungali which also included Anirban Dutta (deputy chairman), Ravishankar Jayaraman, and Yash K Nayak (members) met via video conferencing on May 15. Punjab FC was the only club to fulfil AIFF’s criteria for the process and was granted a premier 1 club license for the 2024-25 season. Indian Super League (ISL) current champion Mohun Bagan Super Giant and ISL Cup winner Mumbai City FC along with East Bengal, FC Goa, Bengaluru FC, Chennaiyin FC, NorthEast United FC and Mohammedan Sporting, the I-League champions 2023-24 who have secured promotion to the ISL 2024-25, received the license with sanctions. “The Indian Club Licensing system is pivotal in maintaining the quality, professionalism, and infrastructure of football clubs in India. It is an annual process wherein clubs acquire the necessary license to partake in AFC and National competitions for each season. These licenses are categorised into ‘ICLS Premier 1’ for Indian Super League clubs and ‘ICLS Premier 2’ for I-League clubs,” the AIFF said in a release. –IANS ab

Title: WA OnlyFans Star, Maddie Miller, reveals below-average mortgage
Content: The West Australian Perth Now Click to open navigation ‌‌ News Chevron Down Icon Breaking News Western Australia National World Technology Opinion Weather Sport Chevron Down Icon AFL Cricket Soccer Basketball Tennis NRL Rugby Motor Racing MMA Golf Netball Cycling Entertainment Chevron Down Icon Confidential Movies Best Short Film Television Music Reviews Books Competitions Business Chevron Down Icon Breaking News Economy Markets Property Commercial Property Workplace Matters Lifestyle Chevron Down Icon Food Personal Finance Health Parenting Fashion Travel Home & Garden Relationships Stars Real Estate HUH? Local News Chevron Down Icon North Central South Mandurah Competitions Find My Paper Digital Editions Shop Now Read your local paperNews to your inbox Camera IconA West Australian Only Fans star has purchased a house with a below-average mortgage debt. Credit: waifumaddi WA OnlyFans Star, Maddie Miller, reveals below-average mortgage PerthNow May 17, 2024 6:55PM Comments TopicsOnlyFansConfidentialInfluencers A West Australian woman found major success on the adults-only site OnlyFans, which allowed her to become a homeowner at age 18. Maddie Miller found her booming success when she started her online career. The teen was shortly ‘disowned’ by her father after he discovered her OnlyFans account, but he came crawling back when he learned how much she was raking in. Camera IconMaddi Miller poses with Johnny Sins at Sexpo Perth. Credit: Maddi Miller TheNightly Get in front of tomorrow's news for FREE Journalism for the curious Australian across politics, business, culture and opinion.READ NOW The pair have a strained relationship as a result of Miller’s father’s drug addiction. On OnlyFans, Miller makes between $25,000 and $30,000 a month and has a below-average home loan debt. She is also considering purchasing a second home. Miller is now 19, and she has already paid off 65 per cent of her mortgage in Outback, WA; she has reduced the home loan to just $160,000. The 19-year-old told news.com that the whole process has been a learning experience. “It feels amazing. I’m so grateful to own a home at this age.” “I had the help of a mortgage broker, but I definitely had to learn a few new things when I bought my house. I didn’t even know what a mortgage broker was when I started looking for a house to buy,” she said.Camera IconOnlyFans creator Maddi Miller has gained a large following online and has become very successful. Credit: Maddi Miller Miller said one of her favourite things about owning a house is the freedom and the fact she doesn’t get in trouble for leaving her clothes in the dryer. The news of Millers’ home ownership has recently gained traction after it became apparent that she was an OnlyFans star. Many WA locals are furious over her occupation. The news.com story was posted on Perth- Have a Whinge Facebook page, and members posted irritated comments over her success, some accusing her of “Prostitution”. Others have been more supportive over social media, with one user commenting on Facebook, “Good on her. She is setting herself up for the future”. ‘Called me a s**t’Dad’s sad reason for returning to daughter he ‘disowned’ Share to Facebook Share to Twitter Email Us Copy the Link Register and have your say. Title: Jennifer Lopez fuels divorce rumours with Ben Affleck as she likes relationship coach advice on Instagram
Author: Caitlin Vinci, Caitlin Vinciperthn
Content: The West Australian Perth Now Click to open navigation ‌‌ News Chevron Down Icon Breaking News Western Australia National World Technology Opinion Weather Sport Chevron Down Icon AFL Cricket Soccer Basketball Tennis NRL Rugby Motor Racing MMA Golf Netball Cycling Entertainment Chevron Down Icon Confidential Movies Best Short Film Television Music Reviews Books Competitions Business Chevron Down Icon Breaking News Economy Markets Property Commercial Property Workplace Matters Lifestyle Chevron Down Icon Food Personal Finance Health Parenting Fashion Travel Home & Garden Relationships Stars Real Estate HUH? Local News Chevron Down Icon North Central South Mandurah Competitions Find My Paper Digital Editions Shop Now Read your local paperNews to your inbox Confidential Movies Best Short Film Television Music Reviews Books Competitions Camera IconJennifer Lopez liked a surprising Instagram post on Thursday fuelling rocky relationship rumours between her and husband Ben Affleck. Credit: TheImageDirect.com/TheImageDirect.com Jennifer Lopez fuels divorce rumours with Ben Affleck as she likes relationship coach advice on Instagram Caitlin VinciPerthNow May 17, 2024 6:26PM Comments TopicsCelebrityEntertainment Jennifer Lopez liked an Instagram post about broken relationships on Thursday fuelling rocky relationship rumours between her and husband Ben Affleck. According to the Daily Mail, the 54-year-old liked an Instagram post by relationship coach Lenna Marsak — who goes by yourcourageouscomeback on the social media platform. The post read: “You cannot build a healthy relationship with someone who lacks integrity and emotional safety.” “You can’t build a relationship with someone who is disconnected from themselves. We can’t expect someone to see us when we can’t even see themselves. TheNightly Get in front of tomorrow's news for FREE Journalism for the curious Australian across politics, business, culture and opinion.READ NOW “When someone repeatedly fails to follow through on their promises or commitments regarding communication, it undermines the foundation of trust and reliability in the relationship. Consistent communication builds a sense of security and dependability.” It appears the international superstar has since unliked the relationship coach’s post just one day after multiple reports emerged surrounding it. Your cookie settings are preventing this third party content from displaying. If you’d like to view this content, please adjust your Cookie Settings. To find out more about how we use cookies, please see our Cookie Guide. On the same day the Hollywood star liked the suggestive post she was also spotted out still wearing her wedding ring. Affleck was also seen on Thursday with his wedding ring on despite him no longer living at the couple’s home. “Jen and Ben are having issues in their marriage,” an insider revealed.Camera IconJennifer Lopez at the Met Gala. Credit: BANG - Entertainment News “They started having issues a few months ago as Jen had started ramping up work commitments and prepping for her tour. “Jen is very focused on work. CelebrityPics hinting that Hollywood stars are ‘heading for divorce’ “They are on two completely different pages most of the time,” the source said. The celebrity couple referred to by fans as ‘Bennifer’ have not been seen together for seven weeks now. The last time the pair were seen together, neither cracked a smile as they ate lunch at Cecconi’s. An anonymous source told In Touch that the couple “will never stop loving each other, but she can’t control him, and he can’t change her. There’s no way it could have lasted.” Share to Facebook Share to Twitter Email Us Copy the Link Register and have your say. Register to comment Already have an account?
